meanings.sent1: The ting of the small bell was heard across the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard the ting of the wind chimes outside.
meanings.sent3: The ting of the bell made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a ting in the air.
meanings.sent5: The ting of the glass breaking was unmistakable.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched, clear ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: She would ting the triangle to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The metal spoon tinged against the ceramic bowl.
meanings.sent3: He tried to ting the glass with his voice, but it just sounded funny.
meanings.sent4: Her voice tinged with excitement as she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The phone tinged loudly in the quiet room.

meanings.sent1: The ting of the coins in his pocket was comforting.
meanings.sent2: The ting of the hammer hitting the metal echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The ting of the keys jingling in her handbag was a familiar sound.
meanings.sent4: The ting of the metal gate opening signaled their arrival.
meanings.sent5: The ting of the metal on metal was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: To make a light metallic sound.
meanings.sent1: She would ting the spoon against the glass to get attention.
meanings.sent2: The coins tinged as they fell into the piggy bank.
meanings.sent3: He tried to ting the metal ruler on the desk, but it just slid off.
meanings.sent4: The rain tinged softly on the metal roof.
meanings.sent5: The metal wire tinged as it was stretched taut.
